sub_topic: Finding the average value of a trigonometric function
message_1: A student is observed playing a game on his phone 4 times per minute for 3 minutes. At the beginning of the observation, the height of the sun is 15 degrees. Find the average value of the sine of the height of the sun during this observation. Use radians to answer up to 3 decimal places.
message_2:
To find the average value of the sine of the height of the sun during this observation, we first need to convert the height of the sun from degrees to radians. 

To convert degrees to radians, we use the formula:

radians = (degrees × π) / 180

So, the height of the sun in radians is:

(15 × π) / 180 ≈ 0.262 radians

Since the observation lasts for 3 minutes and the height of the sun doesn't change during this short period of time, the average value of the sine of the height of the sun is simply the sine of its height in radians:

sin(0.262) ≈ 0.258

Therefore, the average value of the sine of the height of the sun during this observation is approximately 0.258.
